leukapp.apps.specimens.models module¶

Models and database schemas for the specimens application.

See Django’s Model Documentation for more information.

class Specimen(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: leukapp.apps.core.models.LeukappModel

Individual's tissue collected on a particular day and location.

APP_NAME = 'specimens'¶

Name of the application where Specimen is contained.

individual¶

ForeignKey to the Individual model.

source = None¶

Source of the tissue/specimen. See SOURCE for available choices.

source_type = None¶

Type of the specimen, whether or not it’s a NORMAL or a TUMOR. See SOURCE for available choices.

ext_id = None¶

ID used by the Institution or Scientist to track the Specimen.

The default value is UNKNOWN because it’s likely that scientist don’t know this ID.

order = None¶

This field is used in the Leukform submission to sort Specimens so their leukid follows a sequential order.

aliquots_count = None¶

Count of the total number of Aliquot that has been linked to the current Specimen.

int_id = None¶

Internal ID used to describe the Specimen instance.

This value is generated by _get_int_id() and it includes crucial information (e.g. T1).

  • T1 indicates that the current Specimen is the first TUMOR extracted from the parent class Individual. The letter is assigned according the INT_ID_SOURCE_TYPE variable.
slug = None¶

Specimen's unique identifier (leukid).

The int_id is added to the Individual.slug to generate the Specimen’s slug.

_if_new(**kwargs)[source]¶

Executed only when the object is created.

_if_save()[source]¶

Executed everytime the object is saved.

..note:
This method can only be called from save() and is protected by _check_if_caller_is_save().
_get_int_id()[source]¶

Computes the int_id.

The int_id generation is based on a count of Specimens per Individual.

Steps:

  • Check if the caller function is _if_new().
  • Retrieve the ID character assigned to the source_type field. updates the specimens count, saves the Parent class, and builds the ID (e.g. T1).
